home.text: I’m Margot, a French junior developer, business student, and foreign languages enthusiast
home.briefcase: I did a “preparatory class” after high school (a demanding two-year program to prepare the entry exams to France’s top business schools) and was admitted into Audencia. After my first two semesters, last year, I discovered web development thanks to an internship, fell in love with it, and decided to take a year off to become a developer.
home.code: I started learning how to code last summer on my own, then applied to Simplon, a state and EU funded school and social startup. I am now attending their seven months web development program (fullstack PHP) that ends in April.
home.heart: I love reading books–especially in English, Spanish and Portuguese, crafting things and discussing social matters (from feminism to social inclusion to education). I look forward to learning new skills, studying abroad and finding my dream job, part software engineer, part project manager.

projects.occ: A collaborative database of all the secondary schools in France that I made for a ”State startup”
projects.lexicode: A collection of notes on code-related topics
projects.bt: A language-teaching startup where I worked on the website as an intern
